release.action: Converting an array/map into a number now returns 0 for empty arrays/maps and 1 for non-empty arrays/maps.
Switched to Java 5 for enum support. enums are now treated as strings and no longer as objects.
Removed lowercasing of class names when serializing objects. PHP4 did it but PHP5 does it no longer so we don't do it, too.
Added missing array support in Serializer
Corrected some JUnit tests which used HashMaps instead of LinkedHashMaps and therefor failed on systems where the hash ordering was different.
PHP4 compatible serializing support for Serializable objects (Using Reflection API)

Corrected reference behaviour. Array/Map keys and all simple Java types (Number, Boolean, String) are no longer referenced when they appear multiple times in the data structure which is going to be serialized.
Added serialization support for Pherialize's own Mixed class.
